body_html:
Hello,

I can report that the problem on Centos6.9 is still occurring. No matter how hard I try to set CC, CXX the step that executes the script build_pytorch_libs.sh always fail.

The problem (or at least one of them) appears to be that in:

third_party/build/nccl/CMakeCache.txt

the variable:

CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:FILEPATH

is set to:

/usr/bin/c++

I have now changed the value of the variable in that file to point to the desired version of c++ (for good measure I also added an include statement in the CFLAG part). So far so good (the code is building).

Could you (please, please, please) consider building a separate whl for the rest of us still stuck on glibc 2.12? It would be so much appreciated.

body:
Hello, 

I can report that the problem on Centos6.9 is still occurring. No matter how hard I try to set CC, CXX the step that executes the script build_pytorch_libs.sh always fail. 

The problem (or at least one of them) appears to be that in:

`third_party/build/nccl/CMakeCache.txt`

the variable: 

`CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:FILEPATH  `

is set to:

`/usr/bin/c++`

I have now changed the value of the variable in that file to point to the desired version of c++ (for good measure I also added an include statement in the CFLAG part). So far so good (the code is building).

**Could you (please, please, please) consider building a separate whl for the rest of us still stuck on glibc 2.12? It would be so much appreciated.**
